results.title: Years of lightning, day of drums
results.brief_description: Gregory Peck narrates this film about John F. Kennedy’s two years and ten months in the White House. His goals and achievements are contrasted with scenes of the world in mourning after his assassination while visiting the town of Dallas, Texas.

results.title: Year of the Horse: Neil Young and Crazy Horse live
results.creator_credit: Shakey Pictures, L Johnson and Jim Jarmusch
results.brief_description: Spanning a career of more that three decades, legendary performer Neil Young and his band Crazy Horse ‘crank it up’ in rockin’ live concert documentary footage of an extensive tour in 1996. Watch interviews with the band: guitarist Frank “Poncho” Sampedro, bassist Billy Talbot, drummer Ralph Molina and singer/guitarist Neil Young. Mixed with intimate back-stage and ‘on-the-road’ moments from the 1970s through to the 1990s, director Jim Jarmusch takes the viewer on a musical pilgrimage discovering the intensity of live performance and staying-power of these classic rock compositions by Young and the Horse. Shot on Super8, 16mm and Hi-8 Video.

results.title: Year of the Green Centre
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), BBC, Barry Paine and Ken Taylor
results.brief_description: In July 1973, Warren Bonython and Charles McGovern became the first people to cross the Simpson Desert on foot. In their tracks, followed an ABC/BBC film crew who describe the harsh terrain, the animal life and the lush vegetation that followed one of the wettest years in the region.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ABC-TV (Australia), BBC, Barry Paine and Ken Taylor

results.title: Year of the Dogs
results.creator_credit: Film Finance Corporation Australia and Michael Cordell
results.brief_description: Football is a game capable of inspiring incredible emotional responses from both players and supporters. Michael Cordell captures the highs and lows of the 1996 season as seen from players and two loyal fans. Key players are followed through their injuries, as are the politics of management. What emerges is a team of players and supporters united by their love for the game and the Footscray Football Club.

results.title: Yarn and cloth construction
results.brief_description: Shows the carding board, the spinning wheel and the hand loom, to demonstrate the process of converting raw fibres into woven cloth; high-magnification photography is used to illustrate the state of fibres in each process.

results.title: Yap...how did you know we'd like TV?
results.brief_description: During the negotiations leading up to the “Compact of Free Association” with the USA, the people of the small Pacific island of Yap learnt that they were to get a television station and a regular supply of American programs, complete with advertisements for Big Mac hamburgers, vaginal deodorants, Californian Ford dealers, and carpet shampoo. All this was to be provided by the mysterious “Pacific Taping Company” of Los Angeles. Many Yapese are opposed to television. They see it as a threat to their fragile culture and an outsider’s attempt to foist changes on them. They believe the “Pacific Taping Company” is a front for a conspiracy to create dependency and promote US cultural values in an otherwise insignificant but strategically important island. Photography by Dennis O’Rourke.

results.title: Yanis and his dream
results.creator_credit: Amitai Film Productions and Ami Amitai
results.brief_description: The story of a twelve-year-old boy living on the Greek island of Corfu in a small farming village, and his desire to leave the land and become a man of the sea.
